page.title: 01Hoy, Lyrawa Hill
page.content: This area of Hoy is on the East side overlooking Scapa Flow. Lyrawa Hill is about 100 mtrs high and covered with heather and peat. There is a small holding on the north side which is intensively farmed grassland. By the roadside on top of Lyrawa Hill is the solitary grave of Betty Corrigall. She committed suicide in the 19th centur. As neither parish would bury her she was buried on the parish boundary. She was preserved in the peat soil and was accidentally dug up several times during world war two. Afterwards her grave was marked by a gravestone. Many tourists visit the grave. About 1 1/2 kilometers off Green Head. Underwater, lie several wrecks of the German Navyy (The Karlsruhe, Hindenberg) which were scuttled after world war one in Scapa Flow.
